website_summaries.verdict: A top-quality fishing line that lives up to all of its marketing claims.
pros: EZ Spool feature enables you to spool your reel right out of the box
One spool lasts a long time
cons: Expensive for the amount of line that you get

customer_reviews.title: Bad Experience
customer_reviews.text: I received a roll of the line that I am convinced was defective. Several breaks within days of putting it on my reel. The retailer said it had to be my fault and they would not do anything. Amazon would not offer to do anything. Turns out the retailer is not factory authorized. The manufacturer normally would consider a replacement but not for unauthorized retailers. I don't recommend buy this product from the seller and I am beginning to question doing business with amazon as well. They all want your money and then point the finger at each other but wont help.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Good line the only problem that the color change in ...
customer_reviews.text: Good line the only problem that the color change in one day of casting.. But is able to handle big Jack's and roosterfish I buy 20pounds line... You can see the color in the reel that I'm using with rubber band... Get less green..
customer_reviews.author: Luis Velasquez

customer_reviews.title: It is the best, hands down
customer_reviews.text: I have used other braid from time to time to test the market, always come back to Power Pro. It is the best, hands down. It will fade over time, turn white'ish, but still is as strong as the day you spooled it. Last forever on a spool.... Shoot, when I was Tournament fishing on the lake 3 out of 7 days - I would not change it out for months.TIP: Get some dark green cloth dye for water, throw the spool with line on it in the pot and let it "cook" for a spell - not "factory" green, but good enough.
customer_reviews.author: Andy W.

customer_reviews.title: Great line for spinning rods / surf fishing 20# / 30# test line.
customer_reviews.text: Been using this product for over a year, and find it superior to the previous brand braided line. So far no wear after hundreds of casts, and is a lot easier to tie knots~ I always use a double strand uni-knot for terminal tackle, and a Single uni to uniknot for attaching leaders. Have had no problem with slippage / unraveling. Great product and highly recommend it for fresh and salt water. Be ready for some very long casts, and if using mono backing, make SURE you have plenty of Power Pro on to bury the union knot deep on the reel. With a heavy spoon, 100 yrds of line will fly off in no time with little effort.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph D.

customer_reviews.title: VERY thin for 40 lb. Test. We will see
customer_reviews.text: I haven't tried picking up a 40 lb.weight yet but I have tried breaking it from hand to hand and didn't want to cut into my flesh so I quit trying. It should be strong enough to pull in a few flounder,pompano,trouts,bass,and other things I like to catch. It is about as thin as 12 lb.test Stren or trilene but the test will be in the catch. Loaded it on a open face and pitched a 2 oz.. pyramid in the yard. It gave a good back yard fight. My dog even tangled up in it and it didn't break. I am happy with this line so far and will update if proven different.
customer_reviews.author: JHA

customer_reviews.title: Beware:May be fake
customer_reviews.text: But this 30 pound test fishing line which is braided should be very strong. The line snaps and breaks like 10 lb line. I believe this to be fake line since Power Pro Spectra is one of the top of the lines. Have used other braided lines monofilament and fluorocarbon this by far is the easiest to break at 30 lb
customer_reviews.author: Who

customer_reviews.title: My new brand.
customer_reviews.text: faily new to braid. Last year I bought S.Wire in #80. It was my first use so the little bit of displeasure with it was just assumed as "it's braid". This PowerPro braid is wound alot tighter and possibly coated, not sure but it doesn't seem dry and it doesnt frey like the other, feels better and is easier to knot. The other is fine and I won't be ripping it off until needed, but when I have to buy again, I can save some money bc so far this one is proving to be a better line.
customer_reviews.author: d

customer_reviews.title: Braided Sewing Thread, Not Quality Fishing Line!
customer_reviews.text: This braided line is trash! I've used it for salt water fishing and made sure I rinsed my reel after each trip. However, after less than a year, the line degraded to a point that it simply snapped under the weight of an 8 oz weight and sturgeon rig. I thought it was maybe just near the end that the line might have sustained a nick, but I went down the line several feet and suffered the same fate. I lost 3 rigs with this trash. I've pretty much sworn off braided line and returned to monofilament.
customer_reviews.author: D. Paige

customer_reviews.title: A trusted braid, worth the cost compared to bargain braids.
customer_reviews.text: Power Pro braided lines are my go to braids. Have tried bargain brands but they break less than their rating. Only had one time when 20lb broke when it should of held, the line was brand new. Still giving 5 stars because I have had an excellent experience with power pro on several rods, several different fish species. I have landed oversized sturgeon (12 ft, 13.5 ft) with power pro and was impressed with the performance.
customer_reviews.author: Twin Palms Creations

customer_reviews.title: Very ambiguous labeling
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used these super lines since they first came on the scene. Major problem is the Absolute lact of information of line size diameter to lb test and how they are listed in the descriptions. I’ll take this one on the chin. I wanted 15lb test diameter. I got 4lb test diameter. Very confusing labeling. I’ll use it on my ultralight setup.
customer_reviews.author: GATHER ROUND.

customer_reviews.title: Breaks repeatedly :(
customer_reviews.text: After a summer of Bass fishing - I have lost far too many Bass as a result of this line simply breaking - and I have the 10 lb strength level. I love how it casts - but I have simply had too many lines break (and lost fish) using this line - when reeling in average size Bass in the 2-3 lb range. In addition - It's simply not good with weeds or any structure. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: C. Dickens

customer_reviews.title: Bleeds color everywhere!!!
customer_reviews.text: Line is strong but green color bleeds EVERYWHERE!!! I work on a charter boat and if I run this line my clients and the boat are covered with green spots by the end of the trip. Not sure if I got a bad batch but I got 500 yards of 80lb test. I'm running spinning tackle bottom fishing. Going to have to replace ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: CharterfishHawaii

customer_reviews.title: It’s Power Pro! ‘Nuff Said.
customer_reviews.text: The premier braid on the market. Very pricy, but worth it. I had to change my line out 3 times in a season with mono. Prower Pro lasts years. No stretch, very strong, durable and sensitive. The hi vis yellow is easy to see, but for most applications you with need to tie on a florocarbon leader which adds to the cost Watch out for back lashes, which can be a nightmare with any braid, and wind knots Every reel I owns is spooled up with this braid. I just catch more fish This said I would not recommend this for a beginner fisherman. Mono is much more forgiving.
customer_reviews.author: ChasByron

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm, I really recommend it
customer_reviews.text: Can't go wrong with Powerpro. Caught a 6 foot 2 inch alligator gar weighing over a hundred pounds! Used the 80 lb braided line
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first attempt at switching from Mono to Braid. WHY DID I WAIT SO LONG? Highly recommended!! Way smoother cast! Less chance of losing my rigs, non-slip super tight knots! Easy spool, right out of the box! I will be using this on all of my reels. Here in Florida we don't have to worry about the line getting snagged on coral reef or rocks so this is PERFECT! 80lb/300yrds hi-vis yellow on a Penn Fierce II 8000. I will be lining ALL of my Penn reels with this product. Next up, Marine Blue!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Mondshour

customer_reviews.title: Very gummy when new
customer_reviews.text: I went back to braid again for the high grass season & have always liked Power Pro braid but it sure seems like this last batch is extra gummy after spooling it on. Makes for some serious & unexpected backlashing if not real careful. Best to stretch it out behind the boat a few times to get it limbered up otherwise you'll end up cutting out a backlash or two ... or three !
customer_reviews.author: 4strokes

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money, color runs.
customer_reviews.text: I have found this braid to cost-effective, while not compromising on the core strengths of braid. I bought the moss green color and did not like the fact that the color came off on my hands and reel. I initially could not understand why my reel looked green, but after cleaning it with a cotton bud and alcohol the source was clear. I have seen if on my hands while fishing to a lesser extent. I did not see any stains in the boat and I'm thankful for that, but I would expect braid (which is intended to get wet) to be able to retain its color.
customer_reviews.author: Hardie Botha

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Been using powerpro for years since powerpro hit the market I mainly use it for saltwater fishing for speckled trout, redfish, flounder and drum . But I took my gear when I went to Alaska and and had no problem with catching salmon in the rivers
customer_reviews.author: daniel halbardier

customer_reviews.title: Best fishing line ever!
customer_reviews.text: I've used Power Pro for several years. I will continue to buy it because it works. I've tried other brands and for some reason I keep coming back to PP. Other brands tend to snarl up more, fray, etc. PP just works. Of course, it IS brain so there are some things you have to expect. It doesn't work like mono. - Has to be installed properly. - Has to be knotted properly. - It has almost no stretch.
customer_reviews.author: Geeks Fish Too

customer_reviews.title: Beware of fake line. Used line probably. Not inspected well.
customer_reviews.text: Product came in and there was some line already tied outside of the box. It looks like someone opened it already. Line breaks easily and the memory is horrible. I get birds nest easily. Seems like someone returned some other line in the box and Amazon quality control didn't even inspect it. Hope this doesn't happen to anyone else. Too late for a refund now.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny Channarong

customer_reviews.title: casts a country mile and strong.  Learn to tie a joiner knot
customer_reviews.text: Great line that casts a mile. The 8 and 10 pound stuff is like human hair but really strong. Hard to tie with my sausage fingers and old eyes, but really gets the job done. With a small Rapala, spinning reel and this line, you can still get that light thing out there whereas mono reduces the distance quite a bit. Learn how to tie joiner knots so you can use clear Fluoro (althrough I've had plenty of hits when tying directly to the lure).
customer_reviews.author: Douglas P. Grinder

customer_reviews.title: No as Described
customer_reviews.text: Bought White 50lb test 12lb diameter 1500 yards.... compared to new unopened 50lb test 12 Diameter 300 yards Moss Green. As you can see the white(1500 yard) is thicker in diameter, feels twice as thick and stiffer.
customer_reviews.author: Ulises Calvillo

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I have had it spooled for about a month and have used it five or six times. I am certainly not the line connoisseur like other reviewers of these products so I cannot inform to much on the nuances. That said, the line appears to hold up a little better than stealth, and may cast a little better as well. It certainly has a different feel to it, and it has been a little more forgiving on backlashes. Overall, I like it and I hope it holds up well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BEST braided line I have ever used!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time trying power pro. So far I must say I am VERY impressed. I have used a lot of braided fishing line over my past 10 years, but I have never tried braid THIS good. It is tough, smooth, thin, cast well, and doesn't cost me a fortune. The color never comes off and the line never wear down from repeated casting. I will be only using Power Pro from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew K. L

customer_reviews.title: If you're debating between other companies or haven't tried braid Power Pro, you won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: There's a reason I've spend thousands of dollars on Power Pro fishing line, because braid changed the game and out of all the braided fishing lines I've tried PP is the most consistent and last. Use for everything from bass and catfish to tuna and sharks. I don't have a single set-up with one solid line and the knots have always held, as long as i do my part when tying. Only disclaimer, don't try to brake with your hands, it'll go straight to the bone if you pull hard enough. Index finger has the scar to remind me.
customer_reviews.author: william vogel

customer_reviews.title: Castability, sensivity, durability, and visibility
customer_reviews.text: Great braided line: casts well, sensitive enough to feel every little tap, and seems to be very abrasion resistant for a lighter pound test braid. The high visibility yellow color also stands out very well even in low light conditions, which means you're able to detect even the lightest of bites. In addition, tying knots seems to be much easier than with other brands of braid I've used thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Nobody

customer_reviews.title: junk 30lb, constant breakage either counterfit or quality control issue
customer_reviews.text: i’m not confident the 30 lb braid was real... i lost over 100 dollars in lures due to snapped lines when casting , as others have said, it might as well have been sowing thread. junk. either it’s counterfeit or there is a serious quality control issue
customer_reviews.author: ryfry

customer_reviews.title: Switching to sunline
customer_reviews.text: It was brand new line and it broke on me 3 time within 10 cast. Broke once while casting and lost a good life. Broke the other 2 times while barely tugging on it thru some grass and sticks
customer_reviews.author: Justin L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Breaks too easy. Like, way too easy.
customer_reviews.text: I spooled up in the beginning of this season. This is a reel I dont use often, but do use it. I went fishing in the back bays and cast out a 1/2 oz jig head with gulp. Reeled in and cast again. The jig broke off the line. Figured maybe a bluefish hit and I didn't know. Tied another one on, within three casts the line broke again. I tied the line off and switched rods. Worthless to me now.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Beauchea

customer_reviews.title: Green Color Bleeds and Stains Fast
customer_reviews.text: The green color bleeds very quick and will stain any mono or fluoro line it’s touching. I was shocked to see my mono top shot was green after 30 minutes of the braid getting wet. Bummer and I feel ripped off and want my money back.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Not power pro at all
customer_reviews.text: This is excellent line if that's what you get.... The sent me some braid I've never heard of put a sticker on it that said power pro sprecta 80lb 1500 yards but it was izorline and didn't specify the test or length. Then when I sent it in for an exchange it became "undeliverable". Terrible seller. If I could give it zero stars I would. Power pro spectra is excellent line though (if that's actually what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Engle

customer_reviews.title: Power Pro as good as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Power Pro Spectra is, as advertised smooth strong and reliable. Its small diameter and lack of memory make casting from a spinning reel very efficient and it's much longer lasting than mono filament which has to be changed throughout the season.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: It seems ok
customer_reviews.text: Seems pretty good. I got V. Red 40#. this pretty rougher than I though it would be, makes some noise when reeling. It's stiffer than other braided line I've used and actually has somewhat of spool memory, which is weird for braid. I noticed knots slip though more with this string as well. But it feels strong, haven't tested the strength
customer_reviews.author: RyanEnergizerTop Contributor: Calligraphy

customer_reviews.title: Line digs into spool.
customer_reviews.text: This braid digs in bad if your catching larger fish. I've used kast king brand for years no problem ever. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Petitt

customer_reviews.title: the line is rough and noisy and it's over priced.
customer_reviews.text: i really dislike this product. nothing good about it. not even very strong. The line is so rough it makes that loud rubbing noise and reduces your cast distance more than any braid I have ever used. the super slick 8 Power Pro is better than this but way overpriced for the lack of abrasion resistance. very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: bingbangboom

customer_reviews.title: Snaps
customer_reviews.text: I used this line on my baitcaster and fished almost daily. If I ever had a bird's nest then I could whatever lure was on my line goodbye, it would snap, not at the knot, but at some random point on the line. I know this because I was able to retrieve a few of my lures and could see where it snapped. NEver had this problem with nay other 20 pound braid on my baitcasters, will not buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: All temp use, less twist, durable
customer_reviews.text: I switched to braid, after years of frustration with Spinning reels twisting Mono. I fish ultralight 2lb to 50lb surf, in the weeds, brush, trees, rocks, open water. Look, all line abrades, wears out, gets, nicked, or hung up. I like this product, as well as any HIGH quality NAME Brand braid. Beware of fakes.
customer_reviews.author: WearAll Hats

customer_reviews.title: Best braid on the market
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried a lot of braided line over the past 15 years, and PowerPro is by far the smoothest and easiest to work with. It’s strong, thin, lasts for multiple seasons, and it withstands lots of fish action. I fish for northern and musky in northern WI, and I have confidence that this line will not fail me with a big one on.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Doherty

customer_reviews.title: Power Pro Hi visability braded line
customer_reviews.text: I've used this line for a couple of years and really like it. I used to use 30 lb braid for inshore fishing and switching to 10 lb has increased my casting distance by 30%, It holds knots well and is not prone to wind knots in spinning gear. I also use about 2' of Fluro for a leader and the high viability of the power pro really shows what the sneaky fish are doing. I will continue to use it and suggest you try it as well.
customer_reviews.author: reelboat

customer_reviews.title: Good fishing line!
customer_reviews.text: My power pro braided fishing line is one fishing line I know I can rely on! I use it for everything bass, musky, carp fishing, and I use it surf fishing on the coast. Only one problem I have out of it is when I throw big spoons in the surf the line will twist up and birdnest when I go to cast. This is something a swivel will probably fix. Good line!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No breakage even with large snook
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of kayak fishing in Florida and often land large snook in the 10 to 12 pound range. Never had a breakage with this line. Recommend that you cut of at least six (6) feet before you go back for your next fishing trip.
customer_reviews.author: Joe B

customer_reviews.title: Best Line
customer_reviews.text: This line is great. We have pulled in some monsters and the line held up after a long fight. The other lines we tried have snapped but this never has.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Frazetta

customer_reviews.title: Great for all Freshwater Fishing!
customer_reviews.text: Most of my reels are outfitted with Powerpro. Good bulk buy to spool up a few reels and long lasting line. No stretch makes for some hard hitting action with Salmon, bass and pike. I use power pro on my trout rod as well however typically run a flourocarbon leader.
customer_reviews.author: D Treee

customer_reviews.title: is great. Very strong
customer_reviews.text: What is there to say that hasn't already been said. Power Pro, as long as you get the authentic stuff, is great. Very strong, very thin, & virtually no stretch at all. I fish mostly fish inshore salt water & have been using this for about 15 yrs., no need to want or use anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Brad S

customer_reviews.title: My favorite braided line
customer_reviews.text: My favorite braided line. I've tried the teflon coated stuf (Suffix 832, super 8, etc) but keep coming back to the original Power pro line. It just casts and handles better. It also seems less prone to wind knots like the teflon stuff. Heck, it even ties better.
customer_reviews.author: Kiley

customer_reviews.title: 5/5 and this is why...
customer_reviews.text: I fish everyday except the day I go to church. With that said, I fish a lot and if you're too busy to fish -- you're too busy. PERIOD. On with the review, I fish in the Chesapeake tributaries and catch all types of fish from Rock Fish to Catfish to Weakfish to Puppy Drums. The only reason why I chose this product is because there are snag issues every time I reel my line in. NOT ANYMORE! The only thing breaking is my 80lb mono shock leader or a bent hook or the metal swivel. This braided line NEVER fails. It also have great knots in there that every fisherman should know about.
customer_reviews.author: lek

customer_reviews.title: best line out there
customer_reviews.text: best line out there. pay attention to your knots. the 8lb test with braided will bring darn near any fish in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The line was not strong like 40 Lb tested line
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed! Thought it was reliable one but very disappointed me that the 40 LB line was broken three times in my 3rd fishing trips that made me lost 3 expensive lures during jigging. It's the first time seeing this problem about this product and have no idea whether the problem was caused by different manufactured lots or the product quality was not controlled well by the manufacture.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Super fantastic braid fishing line
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely perfect, arrived ahead of stated time. Already spooled up in baitcaster and winds, lays perfectly. Casts are beautiful and effortless. Great fighting strength with fish and extreme sensitivity to even the lightest strikes. Highly recommend. Will buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: love it and super smooth
customer_reviews.text: I go fishing every so often. And my favorite line is braided line, this line is so nice and smooth on my reel that you can hardly feel any resistance, it's strong enough to haul in that big one and overall no complaints, would recommend and buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Cazares

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: expensive but worth it. I love how far I can cast. the negatives are that it is hard to untangle because it is thinner and less rigid that monofiliment line. also, you need to wear a glove for casting and lifting a fish yout of the water.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strong
customer_reviews.text: I love this line, I have all four of my inshore reels spoiled up with the 30lb. It is light enough that I can feel small bumps, but I have yet to have it break or a knot come lose with a big bull red or black drum. The only downside is if you did some kind of knot in it, it is not coming out unless you cut it out.
customer_reviews.author: User86336

customer_reviews.title: Lost 3 rigs trying to cast with this crap.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff won’t even allow me to cast a 3oz weigh in the surf. Lost 3 whole rigs today and am NOT happy. Guess I go back to mono line. Stay away!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Power Pro True Life Experience
customer_reviews.text: I've used power line for over five years and made the mistake of going with another brand once , that would be the last time I do that. After fishing for forty plus years I can honestly tell you power pro has made fishing more enjoyable and productive ,all in part to feeling the bit quicker and setting the hook faster. Find the right knots and technics and you are well on your way to a much more enjoyable fishing future.
customer_reviews.author: Tony A.

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: I didn't use this for fishing, so I can't say anything as to its use there. I DID use it to see a ghillie suit together, and for that, it was phenomenal. The strength was great, it rarely tangled or frayed and even the scissors took just a little bit of extra effort to cut through it.
customer_reviews.author: Eli Newton

customer_reviews.title: really tough
customer_reviews.text: this stuff is strong and really abrasion resistant... they've come out with thinner and smoother braids... This stuffs been on the market quite awhile but for certain applications its perfect. Learn to tie a palomar knot as well because nothing else will work
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: Frayed section on new line
customer_reviews.text: I've read good things about power pro, and I spent the extra money to get quality line. Purchased the 1500yrds of 100lb high vis yellow braid. Got about 2-300yrds into the spool and found a badly frayed section. It is unusable.. probably just this spool, but still disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Taylor McGuire

customer_reviews.title: It broke!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I have used nothing but Power Pro for YEARS. Bought this for the grandson, a budding fisherman. After first maybe 20 casts, the line popped and sailing off into the sunset was his $12 bass lure! Certainly lost our credibility with him.
customer_reviews.author: Lucille Halm

customer_reviews.title: Horrible, line keeps breaking
customer_reviews.text: First time using braided line. This 6lb test line is horrible, broke twice before using it to fish. Would return but line already mounted on spool. Also, box doesn’t show dimensions for 6lb line, shows 8lb and higher.
customer_reviews.author: L. Kostolanci

customer_reviews.title: Never lost a fish.
customer_reviews.text: In the past few years I've caught about 50 large lake trout (up to 43 lbs), 200 large pike (up to 46") and 150 large walleye (up to 32") on this stuff. Obviously using various types of leaders, but the line itself has never lost me a fish.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Thielen

customer_reviews.title: Great, durable braid
customer_reviews.text: Typically used for trout fishing, I’ve had this line on one of my ultra-light set ups for the last 6 months. There’s been minimal fading over that span, and no line breaks. In fact, the only place that my line has broken is on the knot connecting the Spectra braid to my fluorocarbon leader: so, more a problem with knot strength on my end. Incredibly abrasion-resistant, even coming over or around rocks and ice with no problem or noticeable wear.
customer_reviews.author: Carlo Sabillo

customer_reviews.title: Best line for the money
customer_reviews.text: You can go cheaper but then lose a fish? Why?? This is professional grade line
customer_reviews.author: Miquel

customer_reviews.title: Tough Braided Line
customer_reviews.text: This line was used in a pneumatic antenna launcher (similar to a spud-gun), and worked flawlessly. Tough, and does NOT kink and cause other retrieval or launch problems. Used to put a secondary line 100 feet above ground, to facilitate pulling up the heavier antenna wire line into a Ponderosa Pine tree.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H.

customer_reviews.title: Lines bleeds green on your fingers not real power pro
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in this product. I am not sure if this really power pro. I have used power pro on my rods several times and never had green all over my hands from using it. This lines is leaking green paint. I feel scammed by this retailer.
customer_reviews.author: Drod1971

customer_reviews.title: A Superior Fishing Line
customer_reviews.text: Originally recommended to me by a professional fishing guide, I have used Power Pro braid line for over 9 years now and have not found any other brand that performs as well. It is extremely flexible and has no line-memory. It is so abrasion resistant that it will hold up for more than a year of weekly usage catching largemouth bass in weedy cover without any breakage problems. Packaging includes an informative booklet illustrating a variety of knots that work with braid line in an assortment of applications.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I received my line just in time for a big trip I had planned .. seller was easy to work with and got my order out promptly ... Power Pro speaks for itself if you’ve ever used it ... very happy with my experience 👍
customer_reviews.author: It's a great day

customer_reviews.title: Check you cost in local stores - very similar
customer_reviews.text: First and most important.... power pro makes an excellent product and its the only fishing line I use! Amazon however seems to be failing me more often lately.... A switch and go Dino stops working - it gets replaced. I buy 20lb test for this product they send me 40lb.... I save a little money shopping with amazon that much is true, but the time it takes out of my day to repackage and send stuff back or contact CS doesn't really justify the savings...
customer_reviews.author: James L.

customer_reviews.title: Power Pro is the best braided line I've used
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several of most popular brands of braided line available and Power Pro is the best of the bunch. It is the smoothest and has as small a diameter as any. It casts and performs better than the others I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I purchased 300 yards of the moss green 30# line ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 300 yards of the moss green 30# line -- was enough to fill three reels. Have been using Power Pro line for several years now with no problems. It is our go-to line. Holds up well and is nearly invisible.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Collins

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: Use it for catching all sizes of catfish on the Susquehanna river. Fishing off the dam and in the middle of the river. Light weights as little as 1/2 ounce all the way up to 4 or 5 ounces of lead. It handles it all smoothly. Stuff is great and super sensitive. I've found the break strength to be at rated weight or higher. I've never had this stuff slip a properly tied knot either. All around great line. I choose this stuff over spider wire any day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Impressed!!
customer_reviews.text: I have used 3 other braided line products and this one is by far superior. All were same 20lb test. After I lined my reel with power pro, I had no dye on my hands-all others I did. First cast, line whizzed across the lake. Every other brand knotted up with the 1st few casts and i spent fishing time undoing the tangles. I will be replacing my other reels with power pro when its time- as long as it keeps performing. So far- its well worth the extra cost in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Jason H.

customer_reviews.title: If it really counts get the good stuff.
customer_reviews.text: The color runs. It doesn’t tie as clean as the name brand stuff. Don’t take it on a paid trip or competition. I had a lot of broken knots in the salad using live bait. I don’t recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Speedy1804

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced
customer_reviews.text: There is other stuff out there that is better quality and cost less do your research
customer_reviews.author: Michael Culotta

customer_reviews.title: The Best Braid
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite braid. Knots hold well. PowerPro does not fray up like Fireline. It lasts a long time. The lower line weights are very sensitive for Walleye jig fishing.
customer_reviews.author: Woodtick Rick

customer_reviews.title: made in USA
customer_reviews.text: This line is thinner than a lot of them, and made in the USA. I just wish that Amazon would step up to the plate, and post each and every item of where from.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Fudpucker

customer_reviews.title: I use this product for fresh and salt water fishing.
customer_reviews.text: Have used this product for many years. Once you learn to cast with it. You will never use plastic mono line again. As far as getting wind knot's. I never get them. I always flip the reel bell manual and pull a few inches of line. That's where you get a knot. Not from the wind.
customer_reviews.author: WEC

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Liked that that its very easy to work with and didn’t bleed color like other brands it is very responsive and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Cyrus

customer_reviews.title: One spool as expected, but one spool arrived significantly faded...
customer_reviews.text: Love this braid normally. However, this time one spool arrived in pristine shape, but the other spool arrived considerably faded in color. Not sure if PowerPro has a quality issue or the seller stored the line in the sun. Have not yet spooled the faded line to test strength, but will update post when I do.
customer_reviews.author: Jason H.

customer_reviews.title: My experience, stick with the name band.
customer_reviews.text: It’s Power Pro, what else is there to say? Tried the cheaper brands and found this is the best value. Sometimes it doesn’t pay to switch.
customer_reviews.author: R. Wynieski

customer_reviews.title: Best line you can buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best braided line you can buy! I’ve used spider wire and other brands of line and none of them come close to the value and durability of Power Pro. Had a 15 pound coho on the other day and I was hung up on a rock and a concrete pillar and line was still strong enough to land the fish. Haven’t change my line since this incident and I’m still catching coho!
customer_reviews.author: Anch777

customer_reviews.title: My Spool was BAD!
customer_reviews.text: Frayed on first use, popped on hookset on first two bites, green color seeped onto my thumb and down into my reel/rod combo. I received a bad spool. Buy your line in person is my recommendation. I’ve always used Power Pro, but first spool I buy online comes in and is the worst line I’ve ever dealt with of any brand or model by far.
customer_reviews.author: Preston

customer_reviews.title: Fishing Guide Review
customer_reviews.text: I'm a fishing guide on Lake Yellowstone and I will only use this line from now on. I'm catching mostly trout with it if you were wondering. This is the third or fourth spool of braided line I've bought and this is by far the best. The strength of this line is incredible for the width. I wrapped 3 reels with this one spool and still had some left over. The line also bends and keeps its form so it is great for tying knots. This is just an all around great line for the price. If you want braided, this is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Perry M. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Confused on the quality
customer_reviews.text: I liked the few small spools I got of power pro at a retail outlet so I thought why not stock up on a big spool. Unfortunately, the line seems a bit frayed in places when trying to spool a reel. I had to respool way more often than I did the first few small spools I bought. I have no clue how they could be different but it doesn't seem the same quality somehow but only in certain places in the line.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best braid on the market!
customer_reviews.text: best line out there for braid, use 15lb yellow on spinning set up connected to fluorocarbon leader. Less wind knots or line twist and great sensitivity! Best price on Amazon then any of my local shops, saves me gas money!
customer_reviews.author: On'em

customer_reviews.title: Best saltwater fishing line available
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, I have 10 rod and reels and the line is in all of them. Very strong and the 30lb line is strong enough to catch a 42 inch Redfish
customer_reviews.author: Danny Cosmo

customer_reviews.title: Can't even tie a knot without breaking a 30 Lbs line!
customer_reviews.text: Either fake, bad QC, improper storage or any of the other reasons others mentioned, but I literally can't even tighten a knot without having the line breaking apart. Totally not worth the time, money and hassle - best avoided.
customer_reviews.author: Racecar Fabricator

customer_reviews.title: beat line
customer_reviews.text: tried a lot of fishing line, i feel this one is best, you can get the off brand stuff at wal mart and probably be good but if you want the beat just choose this one
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Use a special knot to tie this line to leader.
customer_reviews.text: It is a very good line that requires some special techniques to connect to a fluorocarbon leader. Use the Albright knot with lock. Special knot books show how to tie this knot much better than the booklet provided with this line. Eight pound Power Pro has the diameter of one pound mono, so use appropriate monofilament backing and leaders and specialized knots.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick P. Bartlett

customer_reviews.title: Toughest line in the market
customer_reviews.text: Best braided line!! Always has been and is still all I use.
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: Nice line
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I cant really speak on the durability of it yet because I haven't managed to actually catch a fish all season but that's another issue.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Worst line ever
customer_reviews.text: This was by far the worst line I have ever used. Please save your money and buy anything else and I do mean anything! The slightest tug Will break it. My fellow anglers there’s no crying in Fishing, but there is cussing a whole lotta cussing And this cheap line here sure made me cuss.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Angel De Los Reyes

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: I don't have this line on all my reels but the quality and softness over braids without the Spectra fiber is quite obvious.
customer_reviews.author: Skypilot 18

customer_reviews.title: I love Power Pro
customer_reviews.text: I love Power Pro. Can't go wrong. This is the first time I've used the Hi Vis but I'm super excited about it. I've never had a problem with strength or abrasion so I'll forever go with Power Pro. I bought 10 lbs Hi Vis yellow for my spinning rod.
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: OK but some line issues
customer_reviews.text: Works as described but did have some birds nest on my spinning rod which caused me to lose a $25.00 lure.
customer_reviews.author: Bubba

customer_reviews.title: Don't skimp on your braided line
customer_reviews.text: Tried saving some $ on other brands. Not worth it. This brand is better and worth the extra money. Don't lose fish trying to save a few dollars.
customer_reviews.author: W. M. Greene

customer_reviews.title: One of the best braids
customer_reviews.text: Great great product. One of the best braided lines out there, ( behind spider wire). Dont look past this one. Highly recommend. Never had any issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: SquigMan22

customer_reviews.title: Thanks again smart people.
customer_reviews.text: It will "nest" or tangle a bit more than mono...but...good lord! The strength for the diameter, the flexibility, wow...feels like 15 pound thread. Like...it shouldn't be that strong, but it is.
customer_reviews.author: James Boyer

customer_reviews.title: Just WOW!
customer_reviews.text: Listen, if you have never tried braid, make this investment because it absolutely is. I have yet to stop being in shock of how damn good this line is. Braid changed my fishing hobbies. It motivates me to fish more! I'm so serious. Try it and you won't regret it. Please research how to spool it and use it before anything. It is just a little more complicated than mono or fluoro but it will be worth it. And for 12$ what are you waiting for!
customer_reviews.author: Angel A.

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Spectra Braid Fishing Line
customer_reviews.text: This line is great quality and the coating doesn't rub off while winding it on my reels. The cheap Chinese "spectra" I bought earlier turned my fingers green every time I used it. Used as base on several reels with about 100 yds. of fluorocarbon topshot with great effect.
customer_reviews.author: Paniolo Pete

customer_reviews.title: super strong, no stretch, enough yardage to fill a large reel
customer_reviews.text: Filled up my phantom 25 with line to spare. Essential for deep water, less drag in the water, strong direct hook sets.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Palmer

product_meta.title: Power Pro Spectra Fiber Braided Fishing Line
product_meta.description:
POWERPRO MICROLINE
Today's anglers are more educated than ever. The fact that many bodies of water are getting clearer is exactly why PowerPro has created Microline. The thin diameter of this line is going to give lures more action in the water and the kind of presentation that anglers dream about. The three end braided construction and near-zero stretch make this the most sensitive line PowerPro has ever offered. Whether you fish for Walleye, Trout, Panfish, or Bass, this Microline will change the way you think about fishing forever.

FEATURES
 * Spool directly from the box
 * Built-in cutter
 * Package protects the remaining line
 * Arbor tape included
feature_bullets: Round, smooth, and sensitive braided fishing line
Enhanced Body Technology (EBT) boosts handling performance
Constructed with Spectra fiber for incredible abrasion resistance
EZ Spool (on select models) lets you spool your reel directly from the box and features a built-in line cutter
Innovative box design allows for you to spool your reel right from the box.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
